TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WorkflowServiceAttributes extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Builds the service behavior for the workflow service that it decorates.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
The WorkflowServiceAttributes class is used to define service attributes for a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ReceiveActivity> activity.
Some of the attributes have default values, as shown below.
||| |-|-| |Attribute|Default Value| |AddressFilterMode|Exact| |IgnoreExtensionDataObject|False| |IncludeExceptionDetailInFault|False| |MaxItemsInObjectGraph|2147483647| |UseSynchronizationContext|True| |ValidateMustUnderstand|True|

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is typically called when the parent <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ReceiveActivity> activity is created.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the enumeration that is used by the dispatcher to route incoming messages to the correct endpoint.
Docs.value: An enumeration value that is used by the dispatcher to route incoming messages to the correct endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is `AddressFilterMode.Exact`.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the `AddressFilterMode` property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value used to locate the service element in an application configuration file.
Docs.value: The value to locate in the configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is null.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to send unknown serialization data onto the wire.
Docs.value: if unknown serialization data is never sent; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is `false`.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the `IgnoreExtensionDataObject` property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies that general unhandled execution exceptions are to be converted into a of type and sent as a fault message. Set this to only during development to troubleshoot a service.
Docs.value: if unhandled exceptions are to be returned as SOAP faults; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items allowed in a serialized object.
Docs.value: The maximum number of items allowed in an object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the name attribute in the service element in Web Services Description Language (WSDL).
Docs.value: The value of the Name property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property corresponds to the <`wsdl:service`> element when exported. The default value is null.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the `Name` property.
[!code-csharp[WorkflowServiceAttributes#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/workflowserviceattributes/cs/snippets.cs#6)] [!code-vb[WorkflowServiceAttributes#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/workflowserviceattributes/vb/snippets.vb#6)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the target namespace for the service in Web Services Description Language (WSDL).
Docs.value: The value of the Namespace property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This value corresponds to the value of the `targetNamespace` attribute for the <`wsdl:definitions`> element that contains the <`wsdl:service`> element when exported. The default value is null.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the `Namespace` property.
[!code-csharp[WorkflowServiceAttributes#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/workflowserviceattributes/cs/snippets.cs#7)] [!code-vb[WorkflowServiceAttributes#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/workflowserviceattributes/vb/snippets.vb#7)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to use the current synchronization context to choose the thread of execution.
Docs.value: if all calls to the service must run on the thread specified by the ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is `true`.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the `UseSynchronizationContext` property.
[!code-csharp[WorkflowServiceAttributes#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/workflowserviceattributes/cs/snippets.cs#8)] [!code-vb[WorkflowServiceAttributes#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/workflowserviceattributes/vb/snippets.vb#8)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the system or the application enforces SOAP header processing.
Docs.value: if the system is to perform SOAP header processing; otherwise , which indicates that the application performs this processing.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is `true`.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the `ValidateMustUnderstand` property.
